result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob W Sweeney

defendant.name: Sweeney, Jacob W
defendant.address: W4241 Walrath Road, Glen Flora, WI 54526

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob W Sweeney in court with attorney Harry R Hertel.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM89.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC in 15CM89-court accepts and finds the DE guilty.  Court will make agreement an order of the court, will order sentence withheld, one year probation, CC, will be eligible for expunction, will consolidate 15CM15 into 15CM89 for expunction purposes.
Defendant Jacob W Sweeney in court with attorney Sarah Mae Harless.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for plea 6-29-15 @ 1:30PM.
Amending Bond.  Bond shall be amended to read DE shall have no contact with minors outside of the family of the defendant  (two copies to DA)
Review hearing on April 7, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jacob W Sweeney in court with attorney Sarah Mae Harless.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive formal reading of the Criminal Complaint, enter a plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  $1500.00 sign bond, no contact with minor children.  Set for review hearing 4-07-15 @ 1:00 PM for review.
